responses.content:
```yaml
leads:
  - headline: Argument injection in download-releases.sh
    analysis: |
      The script `iaas-support/alicloud/download-releases.sh` is vulnerable to argument injection due to improper neutralization of special elements in the `wget` command. 
      
      An attacker who can control the value of `$LINE` during the execution of the script could inject arbitrary arguments to the `wget` command. This could lead to the execution of arbitrary commands on the system.
    cwe: CWE-88
    function_names: []
    filenames:
      - iaas-support/alicloud/download-releases.sh
    classification: very promising
  - headline: Argument injection in upload-releases.sh
    analysis: |
      The script `iaas-support/alicloud/upload-releases.sh` is vulnerable to argument injection due to improper neutralization of the variable `$2` in the `bosh` command. 
      
      An attacker who can control the value of the second argument passed to the script could inject arbitrary arguments to the `bosh` command. This could lead to the execution of arbitrary commands on the system.
    cwe: CWE-88
    function_names: []
    filenames:
      - iaas-support/alicloud/upload-releases.sh
    classification: very promising
```

leads.headline: Argument injection in download-releases.sh
leads.analysis:
The script iaas-support/alicloud/download-releases.sh is vulnerable to argument injection due to improper neutralization of special elements in the wget command. 

An attacker who can control the value of $LINE during the execution of the script could inject arbitrary arguments to the wget command. This could lead to the execution of arbitrary commands on the system.

leads.headline: Argument injection in upload-releases.sh
leads.analysis:
The script iaas-support/alicloud/upload-releases.sh is vulnerable to argument injection due to improper neutralization of the variable $2 in the bosh command. 

An attacker who can control the value of the second argument passed to the script could inject arbitrary arguments to the bosh command. This could lead to the execution of arbitrary commands on the system.
